name: name
desc: Position-based source name in the sexagesimal form: "VPHAS-DR2 JHHMMSS.ss+DDMMSS.s". VPHAS-DR2 indicates the survey and data release, while J indicates that the position is J2000 equatorial.

name: ra
desc: J2000 Right Ascension with respect to the 2MASS PSC reference frame, which is consistent with ICRS to within 0.1 arcsec.  The coordinate given is obtained from the astrometric measurement in the i-band exposure. If the source is undetected in i, then the r, r2, g, ha, or u coordinate is given (bands are listed in order of preference).

name: dec
desc: J2000 Declination. See comments above.

name: l
desc: Galactic longitude (IAU 1958 system).

name: b
desc: Galactic latitude (IAU 1958 system).

name: u_g
desc: (u - g) colour, formed by subtracting columns u and g. To obtain the uncertainty, take the root of the sum of the squares of columns err_u and err_g.

name: g_r
desc: (g - r2) colour, formed by subtracting columns g and r2. See comments above.

name: r_i
desc: (r - i) colour, formed by subtracting columns r and i. See comments above.

name: r_ha
desc: (r - Halpha) colour, formed by subtracting columns r and ha. See comments above.

name: photID
desc: Unique identifier of the detection in the format "#field-#ccd-#number", e.g. "1679b-8-5386", composed of the VPHAS field offset identifier, the CCD extension number, and a unique object number.

name: primaryID
desc: Identifier of the primary catalogue entry for this source. If equal to photID, then this catalogue entry is the preferred observation of a unique source. If it is different from photID, then the entry is a duplicate observation of a source, and the value of this column then points to the preferred alternative observation of that source.

name: is_primary
desc: True if the entry is the preferred observation of a unique star.  Use is_primary = True if you only want one row per source.

name: nndist
desc: Distance to the nearest detected object in the same frame.

name: clean
desc: True if clean_g, clean_r2, clean_r, clean_i, and clean_ha are all True. Note that clean_u is not required, because the u-band data is significantly less deep.

name: clean_u
desc: True if the u-band detection was significant and the PSF fit reliable (snr_u > 10 & chi_u < 1.5).

name: u
desc: Default u-band magnitude obtained using DAOPHOT-based PSF fitting. Calibrated in the Vega system.

name: err_u
desc: Uncertainty for u as determined by DAOPHOT's PSF-fitting routine. Does not include systematics such as flat-fielding or zeropoint calibration errors.

name: chi_u
desc: Goodness of the PSF fit, as determined by DAOPHOT's PSF-fitting routine. A value close to one is good.

name: error_u
desc: Details of problems encountered during the PSF fitting, if any. Possible values include 'No_error', 'Off_image', 'Too_faint', and 'Bad_fit'. The magnitude values are left empty when an error occured, and hence this columns is for information only.

name: aperMag_u
desc: r-band magnitude obtained using aperture photometry. Calibrated in the Vega system. This magnitude is prone to contamination from nearby sources in crowded fields.

name: aperMagErr_u
desc: Uncertainty in the aperture magnitude. Does not include systematics such as flat-fielding and zeropoint calibration errors, or any errors due to crowding.

name: snr_u
desc: Signal-to-noise ratio of the flux in the fwhm-sized aperture, relative to the local background measure.

name: magLim_u
desc: The magnitude a SNR=3 source would be expected to have at this position.

name: psffwhm_u
desc: Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the Point Spread Function (PSF) in the CCD frame.

name: mjd_u
desc: Modified Julian Date at the start of the exposure.

name: x_u
desc: Pixel coordinate of the source in the coordinate system of the CCD.

name: x_y
desc: Pixel coordinate of the source in the coordinate system of the CCD.

name: detectionID_u
desc: Unique identifier of the detection in the format "#night-#exposure-#ccd-#number", for example "20120429-00089-8-5386".

name: field
desc: VPHAS field offset identifier, e.g. "0001a".

name: ccd
desc: OmegaCAM CCD, identified by the extension number in the FITS files that the instrument produces.
